1.description: A baby with a lightning bolt-shaped scar on his forehead. Mysteriously survived an attack by Voldemort that killed his parents.

2.description: A small, skinny boy with untidy black hair, bright green eyes, and round glasses. Lives in a cupboard under the stairs at the Dursleys. Strange things happen around him that he can't explain.

3.description: Learns on his 11th birthday that he's a wizard. Has been receiving letters from Hogwarts. The Dursleys have been hiding his magical heritage from him.

1.description: A big, beefy man with hardly any neck and a large mustache. Director at Grunnings drill-making company. Hates anything unusual or mysterious.

2.description: Treats Harry very poorly, making him live in a cupboard. Takes his family to the zoo for Dudley's birthday. Becomes furious when Harry accidentally makes magic happen.

1.description: Thin and blonde with nearly twice the usual amount of neck. Spends her time spying on the neighbors. Sister of Harry's mother Lily.

3.description: Knew about magic all along as her sister Lily was a witch. Has been hiding Harry's magical heritage out of jealousy and fear.

1.description: A spoiled baby, son of Vernon and Petunia Dursley.

2.description: An extremely spoiled and overweight boy who bullies Harry. Gets upset when he doesn't get enough birthday presents. Afraid of Harry after the zoo incident.

3.description: Terrified when Hagrid gives him a pig's tail after eating Harry's birthday cake. Runs around squealing in pain and fear.

1.description: An enormous man, almost twice as tall as normal and five times as wide. Keeper of Keys and Grounds at Hogwarts. Brings baby Harry to the Dursleys on a flying motorcycle.
1.role: Keeper of Keys and Grounds at Hogwarts

3.description: Breaks down the door to rescue Harry on his 11th birthday. Cannot do magic officially as he was expelled from Hogwarts. Extremely loyal to Dumbledore who trusts him completely.

1.description: Tall, thin, and very old with silver hair and beard long enough to tuck into his belt. Has blue eyes that twinkle behind half-moon spectacles. Headmaster of Hogwarts and considered the only wizard Voldemort fears.
A severe-looking woman who can transform into a tabby cat. Deputy Headmistress of Hogwarts. Worried about leaving Harry with the Dursleys.
Dudley's best friend. A scrawny boy with a face like a rat. Usually holds people's arms behind their backs while Dudley hits them.
An old lady who lives two streets away. Occasionally babysits Harry when the Dursleys go out. Her house smells of cabbage and she has lots of cats.
The most feared dark wizard who killed Harry's parents but mysteriously failed to kill baby Harry, leaving only a lightning bolt scar. Lost his powers and disappeared that night.

6.description: A tall, thin, freckled boy with long nose, big hands and feet, and flaming red hair. From a wizarding family. Youngest of six brothers. Friendly and loyal, loves wizard chess.

9.description: Loyal friend who stands by Harry. Shows skill at wizard chess and knowledge of the wizarding world. Has a pet rat named Scabbers.

16.description: Demonstrates exceptional skill at wizard chess, helping Harry navigate the giant chess set protecting the Philosopher's Stone. Shows courage by sacrificing himself in the game.

6.description: A bossy-looking girl with lots of bushy brown hair and rather large front teeth. Very knowledgeable about magic despite being Muggle-born. Already read Hogwarts: A History before arriving.

9.description: Brilliant student who knows more spells than anyone in first year. Can be annoying with her know-it-all attitude, but proves herself brave when helping Harry and Ron with the mountain troll.

16.description: Uses her extensive knowledge of plants and potions to help Harry get through Snape's logic puzzle protecting the Philosopher's Stone. Shows both intelligence and courage.

5.description: A pale, pointed-faced boy with sleek blond hair. Arrogant and rude. From a wealthy pure-blood wizarding family. Immediately shows prejudice against Muggle-borns and those he considers beneath him.

6.description: Sorted into Slytherin House. Becomes Harry's school rival. Constantly bullies other students and tries to get them in trouble. Has two cronies, Crabbe and Goyle.

11.description: Challenges Harry to a wizard's duel at midnight, but doesn't show up - it was a trap to get Harry in trouble. Shows his cowardly and scheming nature.

7.description: A teacher with greasy black hair, sallow skin, and a hooked nose. Head of Slytherin House and Potions master. Shows immediate dislike for Harry Potter during the Sorting ceremony.

8.description: Deliberately tries to intimidate and humiliate Harry in his first Potions class. Asks difficult questions and criticizes Harry unfairly. Shows clear bias against Gryffindor students.

11.description: Suspected of cursing Harry's broomstick during the Quidditch match. Seen muttering an incantation while staring at Harry. However, was actually trying to counter-curse the real culprit.

17.description: Revealed to have been protecting Harry all along. Created the logic puzzle protecting the Philosopher's Stone. Despite his harsh treatment, he was trying to save Harry from the real threat.

5.description: The Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher. Pale and nervous with a slight stutter. Wears a purple turban which he claims he got from an African prince as thanks for getting rid of a troublesome zombie.
5.role: Defense Against the Dark Arts Professor

8.description: Timid teacher who seems afraid of his own subject. Students find his classes boring and ineffective. Always nervous and stuttering, especially around other teachers.

11.description: Present at the Quidditch match when Harry's broomstick was cursed. Appears to be knocked over by Hermione when she set Snape's robes on fire, but was actually the one cursing Harry's broom.

17.description: Revealed as the true villain trying to steal the Philosopher's Stone for his master, Voldemort, who has been sharing his body and hiding under the turban. No longer stutters when his true nature is revealed.

6.description: A round-faced, forgetful boy who often loses things. Raised by his grandmother after his parents were tortured into insanity by Death Eaters. Sorted into Gryffindor despite seeming more timid than brave.

8.description: Struggles in most classes, especially Potions where Professor Snape constantly bullies and intimidates him. Often has accidents with spells and potions.

16.description: Shows unexpected courage by trying to stop Harry, Ron, and Hermione from leaving the common room, believing they will lose Gryffindor more House points. Hermione puts a Full Body-Bind curse on him.

5.description: An old wizard with pale, silvery eyes who owns Ollivanders wand shop. Has an extraordinary memory for every wand he's ever sold. Tells Harry that his wand is the brother of Voldemort's wand - both have phoenix feathers from the same phoenix.

6.description: A large, stupid-looking boy who follows Draco Malfoy around. Sorted into Slytherin House. Acts as one of Malfoy's cronies and muscle.
A large, stupid-looking boy who follows Draco Malfoy around. Sorted into Slytherin House. Acts as one of Malfoy's cronies and muscle.
An Irish boy with sandy hair. Sorted into Gryffindor House. Shares a dormitory with Harry, Ron, Neville, and Dean.
A boy with dark skin who is sorted into Gryffindor House. Shares a dormitory with Harry, Ron, Neville, and Seamus.
A girl sorted into Gryffindor House during the Sorting Ceremony.
A girl sorted into Gryffindor House during the Sorting Ceremony.
Ron's older brother, a Gryffindor prefect with horn-rimmed glasses. Very rule-abiding and pompous. Leads the first-year Gryffindors to their dormitory.
One of Ron's twin brothers, in his third year at Hogwarts. Known for being a troublemaker and prankster. Beater on the Gryffindor Quidditch team.
One of Ron's twin brothers, in his third year at Hogwarts. Known for being a troublemaker and prankster. Beater on the Gryffindor Quidditch team.

7.description: An ancient, patched, frayed pointed wizard's hat that sorts students into Hogwarts Houses. Can read minds and speaks aloud. Considers putting Harry in Slytherin but ultimately places him in Gryffindor.
A tiny wizard who teaches Charms. So small he has to stand on a pile of books to see over his desk. Head of Ravenclaw House.
A dumpy little witch who teaches Herbology. Head of Hufflepuff House. Often has dirt under her fingernails from working with magical plants.

8.description: The caretaker of Hogwarts. A thin, sour man with long greasy hair. Hates students and would like to see them all expelled. Has a cat named Mrs. Norris who helps him patrol the corridors.

11.description: Patrols the castle looking for rule-breaking students. Nearly catches Harry when Draco tricks him into a fake duel, but Harry escapes.

8.description: Filch's cat. A scrawny, dust-colored creature with bulging, lamp-like eyes. Patrols the corridors and reports rule-breaking students to Filch.

7.description: A portrait of a fat woman in a pink silk dress who guards the entrance to Gryffindor Tower. Requires a password to allow entry.

9.description: The flying instructor with short grey hair and yellow eyes like a hawk. Strict but fair teacher who referees Quidditch matches. Takes Neville to the hospital wing after his flying accident.
Captain of the Gryffindor Quidditch team. A burly fifth-year student who is passionate about Quidditch. Recruits Harry as the new Seeker after seeing his flying ability.

10.description: A Chaser on the Gryffindor Quidditch team. Helps train Harry for his first match.
A Chaser on the Gryffindor Quidditch team. Helps train Harry for his first match.
A Chaser on the Gryffindor Quidditch team. Helps train Harry for his first match.

11.description: Captain of the Slytherin Quidditch team. A sixth-year student who plays dirty and tries to intimidate opponents during matches.

9.description: The school nurse who runs the hospital wing. A kindly witch who cares for injured students. Treats Neville after his flying accident.

7.description: The ghost of Gryffindor Tower. A transparent, pearly-white ghost wearing a doublet and tights. His head is nearly severed and hangs at an odd angle, hence his nickname.
The ghost of Slytherin House. A gaunt ghost covered in silver bloodstains. The other ghosts seem to be afraid of him.
The ghost of Hufflepuff House. A jolly, fat ghost who wears monk's robes.
The ghost of Ravenclaw House. A tall, grave ghost who rarely speaks to students.

5.description: The toothless barman of the Leaky Cauldron pub. A bald, friendly wizard who recognizes Harry Potter immediately and seems excited to meet him.

A goblin who works at Gringotts Bank. Has a swarthy, clever face, pointed beard, and very long fingers and feet. Escorts Harry and Hagrid to Harry's vault on a wild cart ride through the underground tunnels.

1.description: Harry's father who was murdered by Voldemort. Remembered as a good wizard who died trying to protect his family.

12.description: Appears in the Mirror of Erised alongside Lily. Had messy black hair like Harry's and wore glasses. Shows Harry's deepest desire to see his parents alive.

1.description: Harry's mother who was murdered by Voldemort. Sister of Petunia Dursley. Remembered as a loving mother who died protecting her son.

12.description: Appears in the Mirror of Erised alongside James. Had the same bright green eyes as Harry and long dark red hair. Shows Harry's deepest desire to see his parents alive.

13.description: The only known maker of the Philosopher's Stone. An ancient alchemist who is 665 years old and has been kept alive by the Stone's power. Friend and partner of Albus Dumbledore.
Nicolas Flamel's wife, who is 658 years old. Like her husband, she has been kept alive by the Philosopher's Stone.

14.description: A baby Norwegian Ridgeback dragon that hatches from an egg Hagrid won in a card game. Grows rapidly and becomes increasingly dangerous, breathing fire and biting people.
One of Ron's older brothers who works with dragons in Romania. Helps arrange for Norbert to be taken away from Hagrid to a dragon sanctuary.

15.description: A centaur with platinum blonde hair, palomino body, and astonishingly blue eyes. Lives in the Forbidden Forest. Saves Harry from the hooded figure drinking unicorn blood, carrying him to safety.
A black centaur who lives in the Forbidden Forest. Disapproves of Firenze helping Harry, believing centaurs should not interfere with what the stars have foretold.
A red-haired centaur who lives in the Forbidden Forest. Speaks mysteriously about Mars being bright and seems preoccupied with reading the stars.

9.description: A massive three-headed dog that guards the trapdoor on the third floor. The size of a mountain troll with three snarling heads and six gleaming eyes.

14.description: Falls asleep when music is played to it. This is the secret Hagrid accidentally reveals to the stranger who gave him the dragon egg.

11.description: A Chaser on the Slytherin Quidditch team. Plays against Harry during his first Quidditch match.
Seeker for the Slytherin Quidditch team. Competes against Harry for the Golden Snitch during Harry's first match.

10.description: A friend of the Weasley twins who commentates Quidditch matches with great enthusiasm and obvious bias toward Gryffindor.

2.description: One of Mrs. Figg's cats that she often talks about when Harry visits.
One of Mrs. Figg's cats that she often talks about when Harry visits.
One of Mrs. Figg's cats that she often talks about when Harry visits.
One of Mrs. Figg's cats that she often talks about when Harry visits.

6.description: Ron's pet rat, old and sleepy with missing toes. Lives in a cage and is rather unremarkable as pets go.

5.description: A beautiful snowy owl that Hagrid buys for Harry as a birthday present. Has large amber eyes and becomes Harry's faithful companion.

6.description: Neville's pet toad who frequently escapes. A rather unremarkable toad that causes Neville constant worry.

8.description: A poltergeist who causes chaos throughout Hogwarts. Throws things, makes noise, and generally causes trouble for students and staff alike.

5.description: A wizard mentioned in the Leaky Cauldron who seems to recognize and be excited about meeting Harry Potter.
A wizard in the Leaky Cauldron who bows to Harry and seems very excited to meet him. Wears a violet top hat.
A witch in the Leaky Cauldron who is thrilled to shake Harry's hand. One of many who recognize and want to meet the famous Harry Potter.
A squat, smiling witch who runs Madam Malkin's Robes for All Occasions. Fits Harry for his Hogwarts robes and is kind and professional.

7.description: A student sorted into Hufflepuff House during the Sorting Ceremony.
A student sorted into Ravenclaw House during the Sorting Ceremony.
A student sorted into Ravenclaw House during the Sorting Ceremony.
A large, heavy-looking student sorted into Slytherin House during the Sorting Ceremony.
A student sorted into Hufflepuff House during the Sorting Ceremony.
A student sorted into Ravenclaw House during the Sorting Ceremony.
A student sorted into Slytherin House during the Sorting Ceremony.
A student sorted into Hufflepuff House during the Sorting Ceremony.
A student sorted into Hufflepuff House during the Sorting Ceremony.
A student sorted into Hufflepuff House during the Sorting Ceremony.
A student sorted into Slytherin House during the Sorting Ceremony.
A girl with pink face and blonde pigtails, sorted into Hufflepuff House. The first student to be sorted during the ceremony.
A student sorted into Slytherin House during the Sorting Ceremony.
A hard-faced girl sorted into Slytherin House during the Sorting Ceremony.
A student sorted into Ravenclaw House during the Sorting Ceremony. Twin sister of Parvati Patil.

11.description: Seeker for the Ravenclaw Quidditch team. A pretty girl who plays against Harry in Quidditch matches.
Captain and Seeker of the Hufflepuff Quidditch team. A handsome, athletic student who is well-liked by his peers.

8.description: The History of Magic teacher who is the only ghost professor at Hogwarts. So boring that students often fall asleep during his lectures. Died in his sleep but continued teaching.

12.description: The strict librarian who guards the Hogwarts library with fierce dedication. Extremely protective of books and suspicious of students.

8.description: The Astronomy professor who teaches students about stars and planets during midnight classes in the Astronomy Tower.
The Arithmancy professor mentioned during class discussions. Teaches the magical properties of numbers.

6.description: Ron's mother who helps Harry find Platform 9 at King's Cross Station. A plump, kind woman with red hair who worries about her many children.
Ron's younger sister with bright red hair. Too young to attend Hogwarts yet but sees her brothers off at Platform 9.
Ron's eldest brother mentioned by the family. Works as a curse breaker for Gringotts Bank in Egypt. Former Head Boy at Hogwarts.

5.description: A portly wizard in a pinstriped cloak who shakes Harry's hand at the Leaky Cauldron. Later becomes Minister for Magic.
Owner of Borgin and Burkes, a dark artifacts shop in Knockturn Alley mentioned when Harry gets lost.
Owner of the ice cream parlor in Diagon Alley where Harry sees other wizarding families shopping.

6.description: Dark wizard mentioned on Dumbledore's Chocolate Frog card. Defeated by Dumbledore in 1945 in a legendary duel.
Most famous wizard of all time featured on a Chocolate Frog card. Member of the court of King Arthur.
Dark sorceress featured on a Chocolate Frog card. King Arthur's half-sister and Merlin's enemy.
Ancient Greek witch featured on a Chocolate Frog card. Famous for turning sailors into pigs.
Famous alchemist and physician featured on a Chocolate Frog card. Pioneer in the field of chemistry and medicine.
Famous wizard featured on Harry's first Chocolate Frog card. Known for his writings on occult philosophy.
Ancient wizard astronomer featured on a Chocolate Frog card that Ron is collecting.
Medieval wizard featured on a Chocolate Frog card. Founded the village of Hogsmeade.
Wizard featured on a Chocolate Frog card. Inventor of the Dungbomb.
Irish druidess featured on a Chocolate Frog card. Discovered properties of moondew.

8.description: Medieval witch mentioned in History of Magic class. Enjoyed being burned at the stake so much she allowed herself to be caught 47 times.
Dark wizard mentioned in History of Magic. One of the most powerful dark wizards of the Middle Ages.
Eccentric wizard mentioned in History of Magic who wore a jellyfish for a hat.

1.description: Author of 'Magical Theory', one of Harry's required textbooks for Hogwarts.

5.description: Author of 'A Beginner's Guide to Transfiguration', one of Harry's required textbooks.
Author of 'One Thousand Magical Herbs and Fungi', the Herbology textbook.
Author of 'Magical Drafts and Potions', the Potions textbook.
Author of 'The Standard Book of Spells, Grade 1', the Charms textbook.
Author of 'The Dark Forces: A Guide to Self-Protection', the Defense Against the Dark Arts textbook.
Author of 'A History of Magic', the History textbook. Renowned magical historian.
Author of 'Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them', required reading at Hogwarts.

8.description: Author of 'Curses and Counter-Curses' that Harry wanted to buy to curse Dudley.
Author of divination books mentioned in passing during discussions about magical subjects.

6.description: Inventor of Every Flavour Beans, the wizarding sweets with surprising flavors including earwax and vomit.
Owner of Honeydukes sweet shop mentioned when discussing wizarding sweets on the train.

1.description: Death Eater mentioned in discussions about Voldemort's followers who were captured after his fall.
Death Eater killed by Aurors mentioned when discussing Voldemort's defeated followers.

8.description: Author of defensive magic theory books mentioned in the library.

10.description: Author of 'Quidditch Through the Ages' that Harry reads to learn about the sport.

11.description: Witch who writes fan mail to Gilderoy Lockhart, mentioned in passing.
Witch who writes fan mail to Gilderoy Lockhart, mentioned in passing.

1.description: Member of the original Order of the Phoenix killed by Voldemort personally, mentioned in discussions.
Witch killed along with her entire family by Death Eaters, mentioned when discussing Voldemort's reign.
Brother of Amelia Bones, killed along with his family during Voldemort's first rise to power.
Order of the Phoenix member killed during the first war, only bits of him were found.
Mrs. Weasley's brother who died fighting Death Eaters alongside his brother Gideon.
Mrs. Weasley's brother who died fighting Death Eaters alongside his brother Fabian.
Death Eater who tortured Muggles and wizards, captured after Voldemort's fall.

5.description: Draco's father mentioned when Draco talks about his family. Wealthy and influential in the wizarding world.
Draco's mother mentioned when discussing pure-blood families.

1.description: Sister of Narcissa Malfoy and Bellatrix Lestrange who was disowned for marrying a Muggle-born.
Sirius Black's mother from the ancient Black family, mentioned in pure-blood genealogy.
Sirius Black's father from the ancient Black family, mentioned in pure-blood genealogy.
Sirius Black's younger brother who joined the Death Eaters but later turned against Voldemort.
Neville's father, an Auror who was tortured into insanity by Death Eaters after Voldemort's fall.
Neville's mother, an Auror who was tortured into insanity by Death Eaters after Voldemort's fall.

6.description: Neville's formidable grandmother who raises him after his parents were incapacitated.
Neville's great uncle who once dropped him from a window to force magic out of him. Gave Neville his toad Trevor.
Neville's great aunt married to Uncle Algie.

5.description: Shady wizard mentioned in the Leaky Cauldron trying to sell dubious items.

2.description: Petunia Dursley's friend from down the road who sometimes looks after Dudley.
One of Dudley's gang members who helps bully other children.
One of Dudley's gang members who helps bully other children.
One of Dudley's gang members who helps bully other children.
A ten-year-old boy from the neighborhood who Dudley's gang bullies.

1.description: Neighbor of the Dursleys on Privet Drive who owns the nice car Vernon admires.
Gossipy neighbor on Privet Drive who Petunia spies on.
Head of the Department of Magical Law Enforcement mentioned in Ministry discussions. Susan Bones' aunt.
Head of the Department of International Magical Cooperation, known for sending many Death Eaters to Azkaban.

10.description: Former Beater for the Wimbourne Wasps mentioned when discussing famous Quidditch players.
Captain of the Holyhead Harpies Quidditch team mentioned during Quidditch discussions.
Polish Seeker who invented the Wronski Feint, mentioned when Oliver Wood explains Quidditch moves.
Seeker for England who holds the record for fastest Snitch catch (3.5 seconds).
International Quidditch referee mentioned when discussing professional Quidditch.

8.description: Host of the Witching Hour radio program popular in the wizarding world.
Popular singing sorceress known as the 'Singing Sorceress' in the wizarding world.
Lead singer of the Hobgoblins band mentioned in wizarding entertainment.
Composer of the unfinished Wizarding Suite mentioned in music class.
Expert on Muggles mentioned as author of books about non-magical people.
Witch who famously got lost in 1612 and was never seen again.

11.description: Famous troll conqueror mentioned during discussions about dangerous creatures.

8.description: Inventor of Floo Powder mentioned when discussing magical transportation.

10.description: Inventor of the Golden Snitch in 1269, replacing the Golden Snidget in Quidditch.
Witch who discovered the use of Gillyweed, mentioned in Herbology references.

11.description: Famous giant-slayer mentioned during Defense Against the Dark Arts discussions.

8.description: One-eyed, hump-backed witch who developed a cure for Dragon Pox.
Chief of the Wizards' Council 1448-1450, mentioned in History of Magic.
Chief of the Wizards' Council who made the Snidget a protected species.
Popular Minister for Magic 1811-1819, mentioned in political history.
First female Minister for Magic 1798-1811, mentioned in History of Magic.
First Minister for Magic in 1707, established the Department of Magical Law Enforcement.
Healer at St. Mungo's 1722-1741 and Headmistress of Hogwarts 1741-1768.

1.description: Previous Headmaster of Hogwarts before Dumbledore, mentioned in school history.

8.description: Least popular Headmaster of Hogwarts, member of the Black family.
Former Headmaster of Hogwarts whose portrait hangs in the office.
Former Headmaster of Hogwarts mentioned in school records.

7.description: One of the four founders of Hogwarts who valued courage and bravery. Created Gryffindor House.
One of the four founders of Hogwarts who valued cunning and pure blood. Created Slytherin House and the Chamber of Secrets.
One of the four founders of Hogwarts who valued hard work and loyalty. Created Hufflepuff House.
One of the four founders of Hogwarts who valued wit and learning. Created Ravenclaw House.

1.description: Harry's godfather mentioned as the one who lent Hagrid the flying motorcycle. Believed to have betrayed the Potters.
Wizard supposedly killed by Sirius Black, leaving only a finger behind. Awarded Order of Merlin posthumously.
Death Eater who tortured the Longbottoms into insanity. Imprisoned in Azkaban after Voldemort's fall.
Death Eater husband of Bellatrix who helped torture the Longbottoms. Imprisoned in Azkaban.
Death Eater brother of Rodolphus who helped torture the Longbottoms. Imprisoned in Azkaban.
Death Eater who helped torture the Longbottoms. Son of Barty Crouch Sr. Supposedly died in Azkaban.
Savage werewolf who aligned with Voldemort and attacked children. Known for his brutality.
Death Eater who later worked as executioner for the Committee for the Disposal of Dangerous Creatures.

8.description: Trainee Healer at St. Mungo's Hospital mentioned in medical discussions.
Healer at St. Mungo's Hospital who specializes in spell damage.
Healer-in-Charge at St. Mungo's Hospital mentioned in medical references.

10.description: Inventor of the Moontrimmer broomstick mentioned in Quidditch equipment discussions.
Designer of the Oakshaft 79 racing broom mentioned in Quidditch history.
Co-founder of the Comet Trading Company that makes racing brooms.
Co-founder of the Comet Trading Company that makes racing brooms.
Creator of the Silver Arrow racing broom, mentioned in broom history.
First person to fly across the Atlantic Ocean on a broomstick.

recaps.1: We meet the Dursley family living a very ordinary life, while strange magical occurrences hint at something unusual brewing. That night, a baby named Harry Potter is left at their doorstep by Dumbledore and McGonagall.
recaps.2: Harry grows up living under the stairs and endures mistreatment from the Dursleys. He begins receiving mysterious letters which his uncle Vernon desperately tries to stop him reading.
recaps.3: The letters flood the house until the Dursleys flee to a remote hut. Hagrid arrives, reveals to Harry that he is a wizard, and gives him a letter inviting him to Hogwarts.
recaps.4: Hagrid takes Harry to Diagon Alley to shop for school supplies. Harry learns about his fame in the wizarding world and gets his wand from Mr. Ollivander.
recaps.5: Harry explores Diagon Alley and meets Professor Quirrell at the Leaky Cauldron. He also encounters Draco Malfoy at Madam Malkin's robe shop.
recaps.6: Harry travels to Hogwarts on the Hogwarts Express, where he meets Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger. At the castle, students are sorted into Houses by the Sorting Hat.
recaps.7: Harry begins his first week at Hogwarts, attending various classes and learning about the teachers. He discovers Professor Snape seems to dislike him immediately.
recaps.8: Harry has his first Potions lesson with Professor Snape, who embarrasses him in front of the class. Classes continue and Harry starts to settle into school life.
recaps.9: Harry saves Hermione from a mountain troll on Halloween, and the three become friends. They also learn that someone tried to break into Gringotts bank.
recaps.10: Harry discovers he has a natural talent for Quidditch and joins the Gryffindor team as Seeker, the youngest in a century.
recaps.11: During Harry's first Quidditch match, his broomstick is cursed and tries to throw him off. Hermione suspects Professor Snape but doesn't realize the real culprit is Professor Quirrell.
recaps.12: Harry receives an Invisibility Cloak for Christmas and explores the castle at night, discovering the Mirror of Erised which shows his deepest desire - his parents.
recaps.13: Dumbledore explains the Mirror of Erised to Harry and moves it. Harry, Ron, and Hermione research Nicolas Flamel and discover the Philosopher's Stone.
recaps.14: Hagrid accidentally reveals that Fluffy will sleep if music is played to it. The trio realizes someone is planning to steal the Philosopher's Stone.
recaps.15: Hagrid wins a dragon egg in a card game. The dragon, Norbert, grows quickly and becomes dangerous, leading to complications for the trio.
recaps.16: Harry, Ron, Hermione, and Neville are caught out of bounds and sentenced to detention in the Forbidden Forest. Harry encounters Voldemort drinking unicorn blood and is saved by Firenze the centaur.
recaps.17: Harry confronts Professor Quirrell, who reveals he has been trying to steal the Philosopher's Stone for his master, Voldemort. Harry prevents the theft and Voldemort's return to power.
